column4: hey, im new to this whole IRC thingy... i am in a Mac OS client now but i prefer to go true commandline
i am trying to do /connect irc.freenode.net
but i get: 17:29 !irc.freenode.net *** Found your hostname
17:29 !irc.freenode.net *** No identd (auth) response
17:29 -!- Hmmm, that wasn't the right password
17:29 -!- ERROR Closing Link: 127.0.0.1 (Bad Password)
17:29 -!- Irssi: Connection lost to irc.freenode.net
does someone know how to connect to this server via irssi?? it doesnt work (hate current client so need to go to irssi)
The quick way: /connect chat.freenode.net
The preferred way: /network add freenode   /server add -auto -net freenode chat.freenode.net 6667
this error messege pops up
i got this error? chat.freenode.net *** No identd (auth) response
i got this error? chat.freenode.net *** No identd (auth) response
This is not an error, just a warning. Ignore it.
I said, ignore the identd messages.
And mquin was asking about what nick were you using for irssi.
i am using nick daniel
quit irssi, rm ~/.irssi/config, restart irssi
But the password should not be the issue :|
then what is the issue?
it keep telling me that i am not allowed to connect.. connection closed :(
